channel.title: Board is either busy or other errors
channel.description:
Hello,
I am struggling getting my board to work. As far as im concerned all files are installed correctly (double checked).
Sorry i wanted to upload the picture of the cosole but Im not allowed.
Thanks in advance
USB device found org.usb4java.LibUsbException: USB error 12: Unable to claim interface: Operation not supported or unimplemented on this platform at axoloti.USBBulkConnection.connect(USBBulkConnection.java:252) at axoloti.MainFrame.<init>(MainFrame.java:245) at axoloti.Axoloti$1.run(Axoloti.java:299) at java.awt.event.InvocationEvent.dispatch(InvocationEvent.java:311) at java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEventImpl(EventQueue.java:756) at java.awt.EventQueue.access$500(EventQueue.java:97) at java.awt.EventQueue$3.run(EventQueue.java:709) at java.awt.EventQueue$3.run(EventQueue.java:703) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.security.ProtectionDomain$1.doIntersectionPrivilege(ProtectionDomain.java:75) at java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent(EventQueue.java:726) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpOneEventForFilters(EventDispatchThread.java:201) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForFilter(EventDispatchThread.java:116) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy(EventDispatchThread.java:105) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:101) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:93) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run(EventDispatchThread.java:82)

item.title: Board is either busy or other errors
item.dc:creator: @DragonSF Claus Anders
item.description:
@DragonSF wrote:

I tried that too, but the "Axoloti Core (Interface 0)" driver does not appear in devices (Zadig sees the port).
winusbcompat only supports XP and downwards (I'm on Win 7 64-bit). Still getting the
org.usb4java.LibUsbException: USB error 12: Unable to claim interface: Operation not supported or unimplemented on this platform. Any ideas?

(and I have to use a power supply, otherwise windows detects a power surge on the USB device)
Went back to a restore point, reinstalled everything with Zadig. Now I see Axoloti core in sound devices, but still getting:
USB device found
not accesseable : driver not installed
USB device found
not accesseable : driver not installed
No available USB device found with matching PID/VID

Read full topic
item.source: Board is either busy or other errors

item.title: Board is either busy or other errors
item.dc:creator: @disjunction
item.description:
@disjunction wrote:

Thanks Johannes.
Up and sunning now. Thanks for the help.

Read full topic
item.source: Board is either busy or other errors

item.title: Board is either busy or other errors
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Resolved by
* Uninstalling the "Axoloti Core (Interface 0)" driver, must check the option to delete the driver from disk
* unplugging/replugging
* Axoloti Core now automatically gets recognized as a "Sound, Video and Game controller"
* closing/opening the Axoloti software again

Read full topic
item.source: Board is either busy or other errors

item.title: Board is either busy or other errors
item.dc:creator: @disjunction
item.description:
@disjunction wrote:

I have tried several USB ports and a powered hub also.
Under Windows 7 64bit. when i attempt to install the winusbcompat driver, it says that windows is using an up to date driver.

If i choose the winusbcompat.inf from the 'Install from Disk' menu then it say 'the folder you specified doesn't contain a compatible software driver for your device.'

As far as i can tell is does appear to be the correct driver installed anyway.

error.png1768x1069 151 KB

Read full topic
item.source: Board is either busy or other errors

item.title: Board is either busy or other errors
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Uninstall the driver for "Axoloti Core (Interface 0)". This interface is a MIDI device, you seem to have installed the WinUSB or LibUSB driver for this interface. After uninstalling and plug and play again this interface should automatically install as a "Sound, video and game controller".

Read full topic
item.source: Board is either busy or other errors

item.title: Board is either busy or other errors
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

which version of windows are you using?

when you say, "reinstalling the right USB driver"... from the Axoloti release area?

I guess you have tried other usb ports, without usb hub, and with all other usb devices disconnected? (need to start eliminating possible problem areas)

Read full topic

item.description:
@disjunction wrote:

I am getting the same error. Axoloti will see the board but kick up this error. I've followed all of the instructions as well as reinstalling the right USB driver and flashing the firmware and using three USB cables.

axoloti.png1388x978 120 KB

item.source: Board is either busy or other errors

item.title: Board is either busy or other errors
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

I expect no need to use Zadig, just plug and play, the driver is provided through Windows Update. Unless I overlooked something...
On windows 8 and later, Windows Update is not needed, as it is provided in the windows installation already.

Read full topic

item.title: Board is either busy or other errors
item.dc:creator: @Sjoelie Joel
item.description:
@Sjoelie wrote:

I'm just starting out, so i Downloaded the latest installation files.

I've also updated the java, just in case. I also removed other usb gear as stated to find out if something was interferring

OS Windows 7 64bit

I Have to admit that I had trouble with one driver update in Zadig.
It was enventually aborted
